name: La Parisienne
address: 9 Maiden Ln, New York, NY 10038, USA

reviews.text: Herrliche Abwechslung zu klassischen Dinerâ€˜s und Starbucks! Sehr gute QualitÃ¤t, liebevoll angerichtet, leicht franzÃ¶sischer Charme, wohltuend chubby (ganz leicht)â€¦
Beautiful unexpected little cafe close to Brooklyn Bridge.ğŸ˜

We had the salmon brioche and a croque madame, both were very good. The coffee was solid too, but the real highlight was the dessert: the chocolate tart with ice cream is a must-try. The staff was friendly and attentive. The only downsides were the size of the space, it can feel quite cramped when crowded and the smell; our clothes held onto the food odors after leaving.
The orange juice is not fresh pressed orange juice as claimed. Should not be charging $10 thatâ€™s illegal ; service was decent and cute place otherwise. Nutella strawberry croissant was good.

Such a cute little French-style brunch spot! The place is small but super cozy with a nice vibe.

Got the latte and french toast with banana, blueberries, and almond flakes â€” so good! Soft, not too sweet, and perfect with the coffee. The smoked salmon and avocado toast was fresh and flavorful too â€” love the combo with lemon and dill.

Great spot to chill, grab brunch, and enjoy some quality food and coffee. Definitely a hidden gem worth checking out! â˜•ï¸ğŸ’™ğŸ¥
Muy muy ricoâ€¦ sitio acogedor con bastante variedad de desayunos y muy buenos, recomendable!!
Amazing place for a quick but ultra delicious breakfast. Laid back atmosphere and perfect environment to get ready for the day! Top service. Avocado toast is highly recommended.

Câ€™Ã©tait vraiment bon mis Ã  part la brioche qui Ã©tait un peu sÃ¨che. Le mÃ©lange marcha-chai latte quâ€™ils ont bien voulu faire car pas Ã  la carte. Le saumon super frais et le service parfait. Un peu frais quand on est assis prÃ¨s de la porte car elle reste quasi tout le temps ouverte avec le passage.
Amazing Avo toast with eggs! Greta portions as well. Chia pudding is amazing too we had it without agave
Very good food ! Recommended 100%

Their other menu items looked too good to miss. The food quality never wavers. The employees show outstanding customer service and genuine pride in their products. This place confirms positive expectations. This restaurant provides an inviting setting.
This cafÃ© strikes the right balance of comfort and quality. The food was flavorful, the staff attentive, and the atmosphere inviting easily a five-star spot.
Fabulous people, fabulous food. Have dined in here frequently and it's always an 11/10 experience. Recently ordered their catering for an event and it exceeded expectations. Thank you!
Bustling little French cafe with baked goods and breakfast/brunch food. The French that was popular
So delicious, so quaint, so done right!
I very rarely rate anyplace a 5. But I had no other choice.

Genau das richtige CafÃ© wenn man ein kleines, leckeres FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck zu sich nehmen und einen kÃ¶stlichen Kaffee trinken will.

Sehr netter Service.

Hat einen gewissen Hauch von einem Pariser CafÃ©. Einrichtung kÃ¶nnte etwas gemÃ¼tlicher sein (z.B. HolzmÃ¶bel und etwas wÃ¤rmere Farben).

Von mir gibt's eine ganz klare Empfehlung hier einzukehren.
Delicious food, the servers are very nice. It's a very small place but worth it.
We hebben hier 2 keer ontbeten, alles was heerlijk!

Update 2025-10-19
Original review still holds.  Had the Chai bowl and the fruit bowl.  Excellent pairing for a light and filling brunch.  Dairy-free and lots of fruit.  Friendly, appropriately attentive service.  Had only a 5min wait time around 11am on a Sunday.

Quaint, charming atmosphere tucked away in the Financial District.   Very friendly and welcoming, make for a warm welcome.  Although the selection is small I  terms of pastry options, none fail to please!  The soft, yet flaky Apple Choussan is a must.  A solid croissant which speaks to the high quality of the pastries.  The pain au chocolat holds it own, a little lean on the chocolate experience when compared to a MontrÃ©al version, yet it will not disappoint.  Indoor and outdoor seating is a plus.
Pyszna kawa, obsÅ‚uga bardzo miÅ‚a i pomocna. Jedziecie bardzo smaczne, widaÄ‡ Å¼e znajÄ… siÄ™ ğŸ˜ czekaliÅ›my chwilÄ™ ale byÅ‚o warto.

It was my first time in New York and stopping by this place was far the best decision. I canâ€™t stop talking about how delicious this place was with my family back home so if youâ€™re visiting from out of town I highly recommend.
Soo good Croquet Madam!
Really cute place with excellent food and service!!! Ham and cheese croissant was so good!  Latte was hot and delicious!!!
Great french toasts! The ceremonial matcha was also amazing.

La Parisienne is such a charming spot! The food is fresh and delicious, with that perfect French touch in every dish. The croissants and coffee are a must. The vibe is cozy and elegant, and the staff are warm and welcoming. A lovely place to enjoy a relaxing breakfast or brunch in the city.
Super gutes FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck in NY ,mega freundlich und sehr effizient! Jederzeit wieder

The most amazing almond croissant. The coffee was wonderful as well.
Cute and cozy cafe. Staff was very friendly and very attentive. Food and coffee was superb! Very fresh and a great to the morning.

I visited the cafe in 2022, and I loved it. The patisseries, the breakfast, the coffee  everything was just delicious.  The team were very friendly and very fast in serving even tho the place was packed. I truly enjoyed â˜ºï¸
Went there before and it's one of the best place in the city to go offline and just enjoy the foods!
Location is just right for a Sunday brunch before a day out in NYC. Great coffee and breakfast sandwiches - the fried egg was perfect on top.
Wonderful little gem tucked into a small but cozy cafÃ© with some amazing food and delicious coffee!

I stopped by La Parisienne and had the Chai Latte, Cheese Croissant, and Yogurt & Granola Parfait. Everything was absolutely delicious! The croissant was buttery and flaky, the parfait was fresh and flavorful, and the chai latte was perfectly spiced and comforting.

The cafÃ© itself is small and quaint, with a cozy vibe. You have the option to dine indoors or enjoy a seat outside, which makes it a nice spot whether youâ€™re catching up with a friend or just taking a quiet moment for yourself. They also offer curbside pickup, which is super convenient.

Customer service was great, friendly, attentive, and welcoming. All in all, La Parisienne is a wonderful spot in NYC if youâ€™re looking for a charming cafÃ© with tasty food and drinks. Iâ€™ll definitely be back!
Looooove this perfect breakfast spot.
Super cute
Beautiful comfort food. Full of flavors and I will definitely visit again .. well done ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ« ğŸ‘Œ
Everything is delicious ğŸ˜‹ you won't regret itâ€¦
cafe looked nice, but service was subpar. coffee and bakery was not hot when served. did not really enjoy eating here.

Wonderful place with plenty of healthy options. I had the multigrain avocado toast with a side of roasted sweet potatoâ€”fresh, flavorful, and satisfying. Cozy, bright atmosphere that feels welcoming. Huge thanks to Dana for the warm, attentive service!

Nice French atmospbere and food was on point.
Amazing authentic Parisian food
Wow I normally donâ€™t like sunny side up eggs but this just had to ho inside my mouth. :) definitely coming back soon ğŸ‘ğŸ¼
Great aperativo! Cheese was out of this world good! Service was excellent. Highly recommended ğŸ†

Je suis venu le matin du 6 mai. Ils ont profitÃ© du fait que jâ€™Ã©tais un touriste pour mâ€™imposer le montant du pourboire (Ã©videmment Ã©levÃ©). Jâ€™ai prÃ©fÃ©rÃ© ne rien de dire pour Ã©viter un conflit.

Update aprÃ¨s rÃ©ponse : Je vous remercierai de ne pas, en plus, me traiter de mentir. Il ne sâ€™agissait pas dâ€™une impression. Le serveur mâ€™a trÃ¨s clairement indiquÃ© le montant du pourboire (30%). Et jâ€™ai prÃ©fÃ©rÃ© Ã©vitÃ© un conflit pour quelques dollars. Si jâ€™ai Ã©tÃ© suffisamment choquÃ© pour dÃ©cider dâ€™en parler trois mois aprÃ¨s, ce nâ€™est pas pour rien.

Came a couple years ago and was tip hounded by the person who seems to be the owner/manager. Looking at the reviews now almost 2 years later, nothing has changed. Mid food. Decent service from the employee but definitely the worst tip hounded Iâ€™ve ever experienced.
Speaking directly to the owner. Dude either add a mandatory gratuity on your god damn menu or learn that we do not owe you more than youâ€™ve listed on your menu because you donâ€™t wanna pay your employees a living wage. Youâ€™re ruining vacations and once in a decade trips for people who work everyday looking forward to being able to enjoy your city.
The French Toast is a must-have and was so fluffy and delicious! Such a cute, tiny breakfast place.

La Parisienne, located in the heart of the Financial District at 9 Maiden Ln, is a charming little French cafÃ© that feels like stepping into a slice of Paris amid the busy energy of Wall Street. The space is a bit tight, but that only adds to its cozy, authentic Parisian cafÃ© feel.

I went with the Salmon Brioche, and it was nothing short of exquisite. The toasted brioche was buttery yet light, carrying layers of smoked salmon, creamy herb ricotta, cucumber, avocado, capers, pickled onion, and fresh dill. It reminded me of how the French approach food quality ingredients prepared simply but with balance and care, letting freshness speak for itself. Brioche, with its rich and pillowy texture, has always been central to French baking, and here it becomes the perfect base for something indulgent yet elegant. Every bite was a harmony of textures and flavors silky, tangy, creamy, and crisp.

My friend ordered the Avo Toast on multigrain, with miso tahini spread, lemon, scallions, black sesame, and ripe avocado. It was so good that I didnâ€™t even get a chance to snap a picture ,the kind of dish you dive into before your phone comes out. What I loved most was how it felt like a modern, global nod layered on top of a French cafÃ© tradition. Avocado toast may not be French by origin, but the way it was plated and seasoned reflected that same spirit of refinement and attention to detail youâ€™d find in Paris cafÃ©s reinventing classics.

La Parisienne blends New York energy with timeless French cafÃ© culture  small tables, artful plates, and food thatâ€™s as comforting as it is thoughtful. Iâ€™ll absolutely be back to explore more of the menu.

Awesome french toasts, one of the best ones in NY. Everything about it was done right. Our coffees were not right the first time. I provided the feedback to waitstaff but the owner himself took over and brought us perfect lattes.

Amazing food, if youâ€™re ordering french toast and doesnâ€™t like a lot of sugar syrup ask them to give it on side and you can take it according to you, itâ€™s quite sweet but amazing taste and must try almond croissant. Highly recommend

This is a cute French cafe in FiDi. I went on a Saturday afternoon, and while it was busy, the wait for a table for two was short (I would recommend joining the waitlist ahead tho). The staff was friendly, and the service was fast. The Croque Madame and French toast were well-made and tasted great. Iâ€™d highly recommend this place to anyone looking for brunch or a quick bite.

Absolutely love this place. The french toast is something to brag about. Fluffy with some sort of cream filling. Delicious. Just wish they had cream to serve it with. Had eggs also but they could either only boil them if fry them. No scrambled, unfortunately. Will be back for the French toast though, for sure. Good price point also, very affordable.

Came here at open on a Sunday morning. Sat at the bar stool next to the kitchen. Great service and food. As a former restaurant employee was awesome to watch the lone cook crank out all the food for a full house of brunch enthusiasts. They managed to misplace my order and offered me complimentary French toast and a mimosa. Great service recovery.

Lovely french atmosphere but upbeat and not stuffy. No more scaffolding on the outside as of Nov 3, 2024 ( there is on the google maps pic). So sitting outside would be nice on a warm day as well.

Food was delicious and service attentive but not overbearing. Don't hesitate to go, but get there early on the weekend!

I tried the french toast, egg sandwich and almond croissant, I recommend the toast was delicious.
The cafe too small and you have to wait for 30 minutes minimum if itâ€™s busy, also you can be in waiting list through the app before you arrive

Ate here for breakfast a few times during my trip to NY. Amazing breakfast food - the French toast being a particular highlight. Itâ€™s popular and you canâ€™t book, but you can join the virtual queue on Yelp before visiting to avoid waiting.

Docked one star for atmosphere because there is a leaky aircon at the front of the restaurant that dripped on me a few times during a visit.

If you want a taste of Europe and a getaway from the tourist traps of the financial district, this little spot is your go-to.

I stumbled upon it after I gave a downtown tour, immediately loved it, and it has become my regular spot ever since.

It has become rather popular in the past year. They sit more people than the place can actually hold so not as nice when crowded. After peak hours would be the best time to come.

Bonus: they have a nice deal for happy hour!

At La Parisienne, our signature dish features perfectly toasted brioche French toast, topped with fresh blueberries, ripe bananas, and crunchy almonds.

Wonderful French bistro, with actual French staff (though without the French attitude - they were super nice)!  I had a PatÃ¨ En Croute, which was a special of the day.  It was very tasty, though a bit of a small portion. The others in my group had French Toast and a Goat Cheese salad, which were reported to be excellent.

Ein Hauch von Paris mitten in New York. Wir haben dort unser FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck genossen und waren begeistert von der QualitÃ¤t der Croissants, SÃ¼ssspeisen und auch dem Kaffee.

Die franzÃ¶sische Musik im Hintergrund und das Ambiente versetzt einen nach Paris.

An unserem Tag war es sehr kalt in NYC (April) und leider stand die TÃ¼re die ganze Zeit offen. An ein gemÃ¼tliches Sitzen war daher nicht zu denken.

Insgesamt ist das La Parisienne einen Besuch wert (an einem vielleicht wÃ¤rmeren Tag). Die SitzmÃ¶glichkeiten sind leider sehr begrenzt.

Stopped into this little Parisian restaurant and it was so amazing so surprising and I haven't had a plate like this since I was in Europe honestly, it was a great I had a glass of Chardonnay with the Burrata and  prosciutto warm roasted cherry tomatoes, fresh oregano, EVOO & balsamic glaze with rustic toasted bread on the side â¤ï¸ crunchy crispy delicious a five out of five a  six star!

Le Parisienne is a quaint & rustic cafe in FiDi that has a wonderful brunch. Although many people were enjoying their signature waffles, we had their salmon brioche sandwich, which was excellent and good value, with a generous serving of salmon. We also had the avocado salad which was great. The americano coffee is also worth ordering. The cafe gets busy sh be sure to reserve ahead & monitor the wait time. Highly recommended.

Was in FiDi for work and was searching for a non-hotel breakfast and came across this cafe. There was a wait but the staff was so accommodating and quick. There is an iPad to sign in on for them to keep track of people looking to dine in. It was PACKED! Very popular but once seated the service to get breakfast was amazing. Ordered the cappuccino and ham and cheese croissant. Take-away was also available if you didnâ€™t want to dine in. Little bistro tables, tightly packed. Felt like a cute Parisian cafe in downtown NYC

This place has everything youâ€™d want for a great brunchâ€”delicious food, a beautiful atmosphere, great service, and a perfect location. Everything was spot on, except for the matcha latte. It was way too hot to drink at first, and the matcha was so strong it overpowered everything. If they fix that, it would easily be a 5-star spot! Still, definitely worth a visit for the food and overall experience.

This quaint sidewalk cafe features delectable pastries, light, flavorful fare,  and hard to find French groceries!  Our Server, Francis, was very accommodating and pleasant. We had a quinoa bowl and avocado toast. It was delicious. The coffee was great. Canâ€™t wait to go back.

Went for brunch on a weekday morning.

First, the good: The food was amazing. Point blank. Maybe one of the best French toast I've ever had. Croque forestier was rich and roasted to perfection.

Now, the bad: It's a bit hard to enjoy the food because it is WAY too small and gets loud. I get NYC leasing is tough and the establishment probably wants to pack as many tables as they can, but you are literally elbowing one another and talking over the next table. I was hit several times as people awkwardly shuffled around me, and a nearby table even knocked over their glasses as they stood up to leave. Maybe because of the overcrowding, wait staff (who were very kind and polite) seemed a bit overwhelmed. I bet the cooks also felt it, as food took maybe 40 minutes to arrive (2 sandwiches and French toast for two people). We were so hungry and a bit annoyed by then.

Conclusion: Lots of potential but def needs to address the overcrowding and long wait times for food before I can recommend it to others.

Amazing French cafe ! Great French food along with wonderful coffee. I had the French toast with a latte. Great combination! Food was delicious and didnâ€™t hold back on blueberries! Service was great, def recommend this cafe for a nice time !

Chicken salad brioche sandwich was not what I was expecting but still great!

Was skeptical when I saw the line was long and there was a crowd outside. They said only 15 minutes which I didnâ€™t believe but got Seated in less than 10.

Nice vibes with very friendly staff. Intimate atmosphere.

Somewhat limited menu, but the those things they have are vetted.

A a few tables around me got French toast, which looks delicious!

Their baked goods also were good. Homemade chocolate chip cookies always are go to, and although it was a little too sweet, it was still worth getting.

My favorite brunch place whenever I am in lower manhattan. From the ambiance to the service to the people, everything is impeccable. Only thing to keep in mind is before you go, do put your name on the Yelp waitlist as it gets crowded on the weekend. We ordered avocado toast, almond croissant and a sandwich. Everything tasted really good. They do have a lot of pastry options so do check it out.

This place is definitely worth the hype. Food was delicious and the service was excellent. I got the French toast and OH MY GOD. The best French toast Iâ€™ve ever had, hands down. Thick slices of brioche with so much flavor. Only downside is that it is a bit cramped in there, though thatâ€™s most cafes in nyc. If you need a more accessible seating arrangement, Iâ€™d suggest visiting when the weather is nice so you can sit outside. Or try going at a slower time.

Eine Oase des Friedens und Freundlichkeit!
Super freundliches Personal, alles kam sehr schnell und was phÃ¤nomenal lecker - hÃ¤tte auch direkt in Frankreich sein kÃ¶nnen voll Flair.
Preise sehr in Ordnung - immer gerne wieder!

Cute little cafe, tables very cramped up if you are tall. Coffee could have been a bit stronger for our liking. Service was efficient but not overly friendly. Food was good not great (Blueberry French toast very tasty, Croque madame was just a toasted cheese sandwich) but very pricey even for NYC.

Stumbled upon this place and it was a delightful surprise. The place isnâ€™t very spacious if youâ€™re dining in but the food is worth it. I had the French toast and itâ€™s easily one of the best out there. Service was great and prompt. Be sure to grab a croissant on your way out. Their pastries look and taste wonderful. Definitely will come back.
